sourceDesc.p: A TEI file created from Ethio-SPaRe data

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5

place.settlement: wäräda Dägʿa Tämben, ṭabiya Dägol Wäyyanä, qušät Ḥaṣey Yoḥannǝs - Zala

note.ab: Gädam. The number of monks might be very small today, but in the past there was a strong monastic community. The manuscripts are stored in the treasury which seems to have been formerly used as rock-hewn church. A built facade nearby belongs to another rock-hewn chruch, the main church of the site. From the slope, the people point to a place on the plain below which is said to be the birth place of King Yoḥannǝs IV. Tabots (4): Sälama, ʾAmanuʾel, George, Mary.

20 Mss. photographed: ZEA-001 “Rite of the Passion Week”; ZEA-002 “Four Gospels”; ZEA-003 “Missal”; ZEA-004 “Praise of Mary”; ZEA-005 “Story of ʾabunä Sälama”; ZEA-006 “Miracles of Mary”; ZEA-007 “Synaxarion (the second half of the year)”; ZEA-008 “Mǝʿraf”; ZEA-009 “Psalter”; ZEA-010 “Miracles of Jesus”; ZEA-011 “Psalter”; ZEA-012 “ Catoholic Epistles; Revealation of John”; ZEA-013 “Book of the Marriage Ritual; Order of the Monastic Proffession”; ZEA-014 “Dǝggwa on Easter; ʾƎzl; Praise of Mary”; ZEA-015 “Five Pillars of Mystery”; ZEA-016 “Book of the Letter”; ZEA-017 “Missal”; ZEA-018 “Book of the Funeral Rite”; ZEA-019 “Psalter”; ZEA-020 “Zǝmmare and Mäwasǝʿǝt”.
